text: people hate to cook people hate to
exercise so I thought if I can eliminate
one of those and combine them that would
be a really cool thing I'm Rocco
DiSpirito I'm the author of cook your
butt off this is a book that helps you
turn your kitchen into a gym so what I
did is design recipes super low-tech I
got rid of all the machines that do the
hard work for us and when you do that
your heart rate rises and you burn more
calories you can burn up to 400 calories
an hour cooking some people can't do
that on a treadmill for an hour and this
takes a little bit of time and
definitely a little bit of strength and
some endurance but eventually you'll get
there
typically if you had whipped eggs you
would get your KitchenAid out and you
know put the bowl in and then the whisk
in and you turn it on ten and walk away
come back and it'd be done for you in
this book I make you do it by hand so
you know that's 10 to 15 minutes of
constant whipping I think we're almost
there this is how you test it by the way
if you pull your whip up and the peak
stays that's a stiff peak
another great way to test this is just
to turn the bowl over and if it stays
it's stiff one of the ways to make
chocolate milk better is to use a low as
a thickener and I grate a low in it goes
cocoa powder and use a little bit of
monk fruit this is a non-nutritive
sweeteners
meaning it's got no calories and then
you shake it so what I want people to
know is that cooking is a form of
exercise if you can't cook you can't
control what goes in your body you can't
control what goes to your body can't
control your health and and tastes
amazing
